content: *warm bright afternoons and cool evenings with sparkling campfires cold drinks in the hot sun the feel of cool waves tickling your feet endlessly long days with golden brilliant sunsets summer is here in all of its splendid glory this design was inspired by the sensational beauty of summer sunsets over the waves * the **sunmelt shawlette** is a triangle-shaped asymmetrical shawlette that starts at one end with calming garter stitch and an eye-catching latvian braid the shawlette slowly grows to open up with a contrasting cabled lace section and another latvian braid then expands further as a lacework wave pattern finishes off the edge of the shawlette this shawlette is great for **advanced beginner** or **intermediate** knitters the pattern includes written instructions and a chart for the lace edging **gauge** 4 5 sts and 7 row = 1 inch *gauge is not important unless you have a limited supply of yarn * **yarn** two contrasting fingering-weight yarns one variegated mc 72g/250 yards and one solid cc 50g/175 yards *i used color me happy pure merino fingering 3-ply fingering-weight yarn in autumn leaves and autumn sunset check out their beautiful naturally-dyed yarns here 1 the original mill run for this fingering weight yarn was 100g/380 yards per skein which is a bit thicker than typical fingering weight yarn this pattern will work well with any fingering weight yarn * **needles** us size 4 3 5mm circular needles on 44 /110cm cable **notions** a cable needle and a tapestry needle to weave in ends **techniques** knitting purling increasing cabled stitches lace latvian braid **finished dimensions** approximately 60 152cm wide by 28 71cm tall at end after blocking **on repeat** two songs on repeat recently watermelon sugar by harry styles because that song basically *is* summer and river of reflection by niclas lundqvist very chill perfect for warm summer evening relaxation this pattern is **free** wear this shawlette to the beach while watching the sun set over the water - enjoy the beauty of this season *in memory of asha my constant furry feline companion who loved the summer sun more than anyone remember to appreciate every moment with those you love <3* -rachael moonvale creations 1 https //colormehappyfiberarts com/shop/yarn
